result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

records.addlTxt:
10:30 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Peter Francis Durni appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is heard on the status of retaining an attorney. Defendant did fill out the paperwork for a court appointed attorney. 
Court will adjourn one more time. Defendant to file paperwork ahead of time so court may review it. If paperwork is filed ahead of time defendant may appear via zoom. If not he must appear in person.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:31 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Peter Francis Durni in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is heard on the status of retaining an attorney. Not eligible for a public defender.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Notice of hearing and court appointed paperwork mailed to defendant at the Iowa County Jail  on 09/29/2022

Prior: 109 East Leffler Street, IOWA COUNTY JAIL (Wisconsin), Dodgeville, WI 53533 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Peter Francis Durni
Current: 109 East Leffler Street, IOWA COUNTY JAIL (Wisconsin), Dodgeville, WI 53533 United States  (Effective: 09-29-2022)
Prior: 129 North Steiner Terrae, Apt 9, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821

2:29 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Peter Francis Durni in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
Defendant is not eligible for a public defender .
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:17 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Peter Francis Durni not in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

No Appearance by Def. Court authorizes warrant
DA states that def. is in Iowa Co. jail - not opposed to JA attempting to schedule a zoom initial appearance

Court does not authorize warrant at this time.

Tickle for one week - court will authorize warrant if no hearing is able to be scheduled in the next week

10:35 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Peter F Durni in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $500.00 cash. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. No driving without reinstating license. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $500.00 cash. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. No driving without a valid drivers license. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. No driving without a valid drivers license.
